definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
(name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out

sentences.english: As soon as the bus stopped, more than fifty people tried to crush in.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车一停住，五十多人马上一齐往上挤。

sentences.english: I am lucky to have colleagues who likes to eat as much as I do.
sentences.chinese: 非常好运地可以和一班钟意食嘢嘅同事一齐。

sentences.english: Let's review these attributive clauses now.
sentences.chinese: 上面一齐看看这些定语从句。

sentences.english: The audience chorused its approval by loud cheering .
sentences.chinese: 观众一齐大声表示赞同。

sentences.english: On the Dragon’s stub-wings the 40mm ROCKET LAUNCHERS open up with a BARRAGE of leaping fire which FLASHES down and
sentences.chinese: 飞龙战机的短翼上，40毫米火箭发射器一齐开火。

sentences.english: The hussars thronged about him and responded by a loud shout in unison.
sentences.chinese: 骠骑兵们都聚集起来，一齐用洪亮的喊声回报。

sentences.english: Complicity makes them come together and attenuate the rivalry.
sentences.chinese: 同谋使他们走到一齐，减弱比赛。

sentences.english: I'll go with you to the cinema this mid-day if I'm free.
sentences.chinese: 若是本日下午我有空的话，就和你一齐去看电影。

sentences.english: The letters were fixed together to make a page of print.
sentences.chinese: 这些字体拼凑在一齐可以印刷一版面。

sentences.english: The letters were held together with a paper clip.
sentences.chinese: 这些信是用一枚曲别针夹在一齐的。

sentences.english: We guarantee the whole crowd will be singing along in Pavlovian unison by the end of the first verse.
sentences.chinese: 我们保证整个人群会唱歌的巴甫洛夫一齐到年底首诗。

sentences.english: Play together, resulting in a polysyllabic phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 一齐吹奏，因此产生了复音现象。

sentences.english: We held our revolvers ready to fire.
sentences.chinese: 我和福尔摩斯一齐开了枪。

sentences.english: A number of warships operating together under one command.
sentences.chinese: 在统一指挥下一齐行动的一批军舰。

sentences.english: We are ma lot of sentenced to solitary confinement , Inside our own skins for life.
sentences.chinese: 我们一齐人都在自己的躯壳内被孑立囚禁毕生。

sentences.english: All four bade an affectionate farewell to the Hermit and promised that they would soon visit him again.
sentences.chinese: 四个人马一齐跟隐士依依告别，答应不久再来拜望他。

definition: to promise/to agree to do sth
different mouths, same voice/to speak in unison (idiom)
to shout an order or command
striving to be first and fearing to be last (idiom); outdoing one another
